definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
prisoner of war/to capture/to take prisoner/(old) northern barbarian/slave
to capture a prisoner/to take sb captive

sentences.english: And I will bring again the captivity of Egypt, and will cause them to return into the land of Pathros, into the land of their habitation; and they shall be there a base kingdom.
sentences.chinese: 我必叫埃及被擄的人回來，使他們歸回本地巴忒羅。

sentences.english: The people of Judah were taken captive to Babylon because of their unfaithfulness.
sentences.chinese: 猶大人因犯罪就被擄到巴比倫。

sentences.english: And Judah was carried away into exile to Babylon for their unfaithfulness .
sentences.chinese: 猶大人因犯罪就被擄到巴比倫。

sentences.english: Nevertheless the Kenite shall be wasted, until Asshur shall carry thee away captive.
sentences.chinese: 然而基尼必至衰微，直到亞述把你擄去。

sentences.english: He let them be pitied by all those who held them captive.
sentences.chinese: 使他們在俘擄他們的人前，成爲自己慈愛憐憫的因緣。

sentences.english: Two dogs for Guo cut prisoners, also to take eight finger blood hacked joe.
sentences.chinese: 二狗頂替郭割擄，同樣就要擔下砍死喬八指的血債。

sentences.english: The whole company that had returned from exile built booths and lived in them.
sentences.chinese: 從擄到之地歸回的全會衆就搭棚，住在棚裏。

sentences.english: What was the turning point for Israelites to turn from defeat to victory in the Ark lost event?
sentences.chinese: 約櫃被擄事件以色列轉敗爲勝的關鍵何在？

sentences.english: Guo cut off abducted, two dogs naturally come to meet Fang jie.
sentences.chinese: 郭割擄已死，二狗自然要來見見方捷。

sentences.english: He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.
sentences.chinese: 他把謀士剝衣擄去，又使審判官變成愚人。

sentences.english: And the children of the captivity kept the passover upon the fourteenth day of the first month.
sentences.chinese: 正月十四日，被擄歸回的人守逾越節。

sentences.english: God wanted all the idolatrous influences removed from His people who would later return after the seventy-year captivity in Babylon.
sentences.chinese: 上帝要百姓被擄歸回後，完全脫離拜偶像之罪的影響。

sentences.english: But God knew what they were saying and wanted to encourage those who were in exile.
sentences.chinese: 但神知道他們說了這話，於是便要鼓勵那些被擄的人。

sentences.english: You will have sons and daughters but you will not keep them, because they will go into captivity.
sentences.chinese: 你生兒養女，卻不算是你的，因爲必被擄去。

sentences.english: A number of the workers were forced immigrants from other countries.
sentences.chinese: 許多勞工都是從國外強擄而來的。

sentences.english: And the captivity of this host of the children of Israel shall possess that of the Canaanites, even unto Zarephath;
sentences.chinese: 在迦南人中被擄的以色列衆人，必得地直到撒勒法。

definition: simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
to neglect/to skip (class or work)/to waste (time)/vast/loose-fitting
thin or slender/finely particulate/thin and soft/fine/delicate/trifling/(of a sound) quiet/frugal
to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown
to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain
chain/cable (unit of length: 100 fathoms, about 185 m)/chain (unit of length: 66 feet, about 20 m)/to chain/to enchain
